abstract: Argentine Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner suggests 'rogue spies' had hand in death of prosecutor Alberto Nisman, who was investigating 1994 bombing of Jewish center; dismisses Nisman's accusations of government collusion with Iran, citing statement from former Interpol secretary general that Argentina never requested lifting of arrest warrants for Iranian officials.
lead_paragraph: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, in her second public appearance after the mysterious death of a prosecutor, blamed outside forces for provoking upheaval.
snippet: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, in her second public appearance after the mysterious death of a prosecutor, blamed outside forces for provoking upheaval.

headline.main: Argentine Leader Pleads For Unity During Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Argentine Leader Pleads for Unity During Inquiry
